quest.name: Gaelicat's Out of the Bag
journal:
Muna Vanu looks happy to see you.
※The difficulty of this quest will be synced to your current level.

Muna Vanu says Ginu Vanu has been looking for you for a task that involves quick reflexes.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

Ginu Vanu has requested that you bring him a clowder of gaelicats, hale and hearty. Handing over the Gundu tribe's “secret dried herb,” he asks you to search the areas around Camp Cloudtop for the flying felines and capture five.
You have successfully captured the gaelicats, which are now writhing and purring pleasantly in your sack. Return to Ok' Gundu Nakki and deliver the precious cargo to Ginu Vanu.

After traversing the large swaths of land around Camp Cloudtop to retrieve a sackful of euphoric gaelicats, you hand them over to a satisfied Ginu...who intends to release them back to the sky as per the Gundu nest-building custom.
objectives: Capture stray gaelicats using the dried cloudcrawler.
Deliver the clowder of gaelicats to Ginu Vanu.

dialogue.name: MUNAVANU
dialogue.text: Ah, netherling graces us with herhis presence!

dialogue.name: MUNAVANU
dialogue.text: Ginu Vanu has been looking for netherling. He busily prepares nests for first roost and says he is in need of netherling's strong, firm grip and movement fast as lightning.

dialogue.name: GINUVANU
dialogue.text: Netherling always comes at right time, like raindrops falling on wilted leaves. Will shehe help Ginu with very important task?

dialogue.name: GINUVANU
dialogue.text: Ginu is so very busy, fluffing up newly built nests for new life on Ok' Gundu Nakki. He needs netherling to bring him gaelicats to complete nests. But make sure cats are unharmed. They must be happy, full of life! If netherling brings dead gaelicats, Ginu feels downpour of sadness.

dialogue.name: GINUVANU
dialogue.text: Ginu gives you Gundu tribe's secret dried herb to catch flying cats easily. If netherling holds this under gaelicat's nose, it becomes happy...very happy. Five cats should be enough for Ginu to complete nests. Now, go, netherling! Zephyr winds at your back!

dialogue.name: GINUVANU
dialogue.text: Only gaelicat knows why herb makes him happy. Clear as sunlight, Ginu knows herb has no effect on him.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The stray gaelicat bristles its fur.

dialogue.name: GINUVANU
dialogue.text: Has netherling brought what Ginu asks? No scratches? No bruised wings?

dialogue.name: GINUVANU
dialogue.text: Ah, yes! Gaelicats roll warmly like distant thunder on summer night! Much thanks to netherling for bringing good stock!

dialogue.name: GINUVANU
dialogue.text: What do gaelicats have to do with building nests, netherling asks? Tradition! When nests complete for roosting, start of new life follows the path wind blows.

dialogue.name: GINUVANU
dialogue.text: Gaelicats are lucky, know very well of which wind bodes good fortune. So Ginu releases gaelicats back to sky to show which way nest should face. If cats fly west, nest faces west! If cats scatter to four corners...well, any direction is good direction!
